content: the yarn i used is a recycled brushed wool/nylon blend from a thrift store sweater that i hand-dyed with a tie- dye kit from the craft store it has a fuzzy loft that works up nicely in this design this pattern is easily adapted to just about any yarn you like materials yarn worsted weight approximately 300 yards crochet hook size h or appropriate size for your yarn gauge not important instructions loosley chain until your chain is as long as you want your scarf mine is 280ch turn row 1 double_crochet in third chain from hook and in each chain across chain 1 turn row 2 single_crochet in first and each double_crochet across chain 3 turn repeat row 1 and 2 until your scarf is a wide as you like mine is 7 repeats single_crochet 2 rounds around entire scarf this is optional but gives a nice finish to your scarf fringe optional cut 6-inch pieces of yarn attach fringe at ends of scarf i used 4 strands placed in every other single_crochet across a total of 96 strands of yarn
